page.title: 19POLICING IN CONNEL AREA
page.content: There is one police constable station_ ed at the Police House in Connel.From there he covers the villages of Connel,North Connel,Benderloch,Bonawe, Barcaldine and Dunbeg. In summer a large amount of time is spent dealing with road accidents. The 'beat'has a total of 39 miles of roads and a total acreage of 54,720 acres.The population in winter is 2,500 but it increases to about 10,000 in summer. In 1984 the policeman attended 26 fires in the area.There is very little serious crime.Occasionally houses are broken into and property stolen.Time is spent dealing with routine enquiries like firearms and shotgun certificates which are due for renewal.The policeman has to attend and enquire into any sudden death in the area.
